channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL

item.title: Report X-2023080560
item.description:
Report X-2023080560

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-31
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was found wet at Orlando Local terminal and moved to the hub for reports. DescribePack: The cap on one of the jugs of Rapicide PA, Part b came off, causing all of its contents to leak out over the other jugs in the box.q DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was put into a bag and dropped into a yellow salvage drum.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During package delivery the package was found to be leaking. The package was separated away from the other package. DescribePack: The cap of the bottle was off and a small cracked was found on another bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a plastic bag and brought back to the station and place a plastic bin.

Upon inspection the caps were loose causing them to leak out DescribePack: The caps on the top of the container were loose on the bottles DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a plastic container in a Hazmat bag until inspection where it was put in a drum and sealed

item.title: Report E-2023080334
item.description:
Report E-2023080334

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-27
  • City: PENSACOLA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 27, 2023, one (1) 30-gallon drum of UN1791 was punctured by adjacent freight and released approximately two (2) cups of product to the trailer floor and surrounding freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental & Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted surfaces. The spill was cleaned and the damaged 30-gallon drum was overpacked for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023080484
item.description:
Report X-2023080484

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet. Upon inspection found 1 bottle of Zee Hand-E-San alcohol antiseptic 80% 1-gallon had loose lid resulted to leakage. Package had flammable liquid diamond but no OP-900 on outer box. Shipping label was a normal label, not the hazmat approved shipping label. DescribePack: Bottle had loose lid resulted to leakage. Package had flammable liquid diamond but doesn't have the OP-900 or hazmat certificate to go with package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report E-2023080144
item.description:
Report E-2023080144

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-07
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the metal 55 gallon drum of paint (un1263) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 1 ounce of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release. so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023070076
item.description:
Report X-2023070076

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-16
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: package was observed to be warm to the touch. upon inspection discovered to contain multiple inner packagings with multiple Lithium Ion Batteries/Undeclared DG. Outer package has no DG markings or labels. One battery had slight discharge. no smoke or visible signs of fire. shipment secured in salvage drum pending FAA inspection.
